handNote.seg: Monumental script, definitly of type 1a, resembeles the script attested in Abbā Garimā Gospels A and C. fourth/fifth to sixth/seventh century
Red ink was used to layout the letter. Each of three pages has the same mise en texte: three red lines from the top interchange with the black lines.

handNote.date: the script can be considered contemporary to KingLālibālā
handNote.note: Some strokes to mark numerals seem to be added later.

handNote.seg: This hand is attested three time, in CCR 6 and CCR 14, added in the empty spaces in the Gospel. CCR 14 mentions certain ዐቃቤ ሰዐታት ሰንበት መሓረ and ንጉሥ፡ ውድም፡ አርዐድ፡ , which gives us terminus non ante quem this hand had its additions.

handNote.date: the script seems to be contemporary to h4,1294-1299.

decoDesc.summary: According to the foliation introduced by Alessandro Bausi, f.1v contains a big cross of one-page size. It is followed by 11 illustrated pages, ff. 2r-7r. These pages include the Eusebian Apparatus (3+7 arrangement), followed by a «Fontana della vita» or «tempietto» or θόλος, the Short Cycle, set under arches made of coloured bands. The manuscript’s decorative features, Bluetenblattstil were not dated precisely, but the XIV century was proposed as a terminus non poste quem. They appear to all be by the same artist.
decoDesc.decoNote: The first miniature according to the sequence attested by Carlo Conti Rossini, Roger Schneider and Alessandro Bausi contains a big cross of one-page size, belonging to the same style as the rest.

decoNote.desc: The runs between and is placed under coloured arches, ornamented variously, that rest on curtained columns.
The run between . The artists adopts the same decorative devices used to frame the preceding letter. The Canons are placed under coloured arches, ornamented variously, that rest on curtained columns.

A representation of the follows, as is conventional, the Eusebian Apparatus. Highly stylized, it features four columns, an interlace pattern, and a low chancel. Above its cross-topped roof, there are two ostrich birds, sitting on the both sides of a tree. The caption inside the Tempietto, which normally highlights its symbolism, is vanishing but still visible. ኑባሬ፡ ሥርዐት፡ ዘኅብሩ፡ አርባዕቱ፡ ወንጌላት።

As Roger Scnheider commented in his unpublished notes, 'La version A de Conti Rossini a du se trouver dans la parti du début, parmi les textes varies et n’a pas été photographiée. D’après les variantes graphies de A données par Conti Rossini, la copie plus récente que B. B n’a pas de colonnes. Photo p.2. Ligne pointillée au-dessus du texte.' Marie-Laure Derat's edition, thus, relies on the image taken by Roger Schneider and the apparatus of Conti Rossini for B.

q.seg: In the Name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit,

I promoted, I assinged, I devided.I, ḥaṣāni Lālibālā, my royal name being Gabra Masqal on the third day of the month of Mayazyain 409th year of mercy, mighty man, who is not conquered by an enemy by the power of the Cross of Jesus Christ, son of Morārā, son of Zānsəyum, son of ʾĀsdā,

I gave to Maṭāʿ of ʾAham, the name of
my wife is Masqal Kəbrā,fearer of God, Biḥat on the river Ḫaṣaro, ʾƎnqarʿo, christian Zaredā, with their land, lying low (ጽዱፉ) and in its steep of ʿĀgāmā and Də’du‘, where neither ‘āqābē ṣanṣan, nor kantibā should enter, where no other tax from anyone [sould be] set apart from ʾabbot of the monastery of Maṭāʿ. And whoever would violate it or defraud it or withdraw it, whether he would reign or provoke, whether he would be appointed or would hold rulership, whether appointed or displaced, who ever will restrain this gwǝlt, shall that one assigned be excommunicated in front of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, by the mouth of our father Maṭāʿ,by the mouth of ṗāṗāsāt, by the mouth of the 318 orthodox, by the mouth of 15 prophets, by the mouth of 12 apostles, Amen. Amen.

q.note: CCR 4 = [5.0]: (II f. 7v), according to AB. It is page 5 according to Roger Schneider. Carlo Conti Rossini comments on p. 185 : 'Atto indubbiamente apocrifo, che trae dal Gadla Libanos.'

item.q:
In the Name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit,
I, Gabra Masqal, gave sixty fields of ʾAham to the church, so that they shall celebrate the commemoration of Maṭāʿ, to be granted in the Heavenly Kingdom. If there is someone who would violate it or defraud it, be excommunicated by the mouth of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit.

msItem.note: [5.0] = CCR 19: (II f. 8r-v), according to AB. Textual variants corresponds to Conti Rossini's "A". Carlo Conti Rossini comments on pp.202-203: 'A scrittura del sec. XVI. La data corrisponde al 1321. Come è noto, ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon, passanti i primi tempi in cui aspramente combattè il clero, fu poi favorevolissime alla chiesa: un ms. del British Museum contiene sue donazioni alla cattedrale di Aksum, la storia delle sue guerre contro l'Adal ne celebra la pietà, e il il Gadla ʾEwosṭātewos,che ne ricorda le presecuzioni de'primi anni di regno, ne piange la morte, chiamando "colonna della fede". Nella citata storia delle sue guerre, ed. Perruchon Ṣyon alle pagg. 10, 11, 16, 17, 30-31 sta cetramente a designare Aksum, che ancor oggi è comunemente così chiamata. Degna di osservazione è l'allusione alla poligamia del re, il che concorda pienamente con i dati della storia in quistione. Non potrebbe poi passarsi sollo silenzio la diversità di redazione fra gli atti di questo re e queilli di re Lālibālā'.

item.q: To the glory of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit. Donated I, ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon to ʾabbā Maṭāʿ this gwəlt: Ṣǝdāʾ, ʾAsirā, Labāsiro, Gamāʾ, Zenā Kudo, ʾAd Ḥǝlmo, ʾOnā Sābāy, Sənāgā, Māryāle, Sarʿe, Lago, Wankab, the monastery of the monks of the church of martyrs ʾAnānyā, ʾAzāryā and Misāʾel, so that he may beseech a reward for me in the Heavenly Kingdom. If there is anyone who perverts it or violates it, may he be excommunicated.
item.note: [5.6] = CCR 24: (II f. 11r), according to AB. Carlo Conti Rossini comments on p. 211: 'Scrittura del secolo XVII. Atto di dubbia attendibilità, troppo scostandosi dalla forma consueta degli atti di ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon.' Roger Schneider repeats Conti Rossini, and concludes the following: 'Conti Rossini rightly doubts the authenticity of thic act, because the form of the text differs completely from the one used by ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon. He dates the writing to the XVIIth century. It is very poor and unskilled, difficult to date, but surely late.' Many of the place names of this act occur in CCR 1 too.

item.q:
በአኰቴተ፡አከብ፡ወወልድ፡ወመንፈስ፡ቅዱስ፡ አግባእኩ፡አነ፡ አምደ፡ጽዮን፡ዘንተ፡ጕልተ፡ሰማዝ፡ጕናጕና፡ቤት፡ነበይት፡አገርሕሤ፡አዲ፡ግዶም፡ ዕፅ፡ማሬ፡አንበሰት፡አጋሜ፡ምስለ፡ምድሮሙ፡ከመ፡ይኵኖ፡መርሐ፡በመንግሥተ፡
ሰማያት፡ለዓለመ፡ዓለም፡አሜን። NB! CCR changes አከብ፡ into አብ፡ and ሰማዝ፡ into ከመዝ፡ without noting these emendations (?). As follows, the draft of translation, found in the archive of Roger Schneider, contains Kamaz (with a question mark) as a place name. In RS transcription is ommited ጕልተ፡.

To the glory of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit. Restored I,ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon,this gwǝlt of Samāz, Gwunāgwunā, Bet Nabayt, ʾAgarḥǝse, ʾAddi Gǝdom, ʿƎṣ Māre, ʾAnbasat, ʾAgāme with theirs lands so that He may be for him an instructor in the
Heavenly Kingdom unto the ages of ages, amen. In the draft trasnlation it reads 'so that it may be for him a conductior'.

item.q: Mədra Tedrar in Ḥamḥam Qalāy and in Nāʿle and in ʾAragan in Kəʾeti Faləg gave gwǝlt to Holy Libānos our King Gabra Masqal so that He may be for him an instructor in the Heavenly Kingdom. What was given as a gwǝlt can not be counted for it is a lot.

item.note: [5.10]: (II f. 12vb, bianco f. 12va), according to AB.

item.q: In the 35th year of Mercy, in the days of our King Zarʾa Yāʿqob and whose regnal name is Qʷasṭanṭinos, in the 25th year since he has started to reign, the one who gave a pillar to the church of Maṭāʿ, Tasfā ʾIyasus, sǝyum of Gǝlo Makadā, son of Yǝsmo, may He bless his soul, his wife and his children. May he write his name in the Book of Life thought the prayers of Holy Maṭāʿ. And you, the holy ones, do not forget him in your prayers unto the ages of ages, amen. NB: contrary to the index proposed by Alessandro Bausi, I interpret ይበርክ፡ as a verb ይባርክ፡, the same joice was done by a translator, who worked with Roger Schneider.
item.note: [5.10] = CCR 26: (II f. 12vb), according to AB. Carlo Conti Rossini comments on p. 212: 'Scrittura del secolo XVII (?): colonna. La data corrisponde al 1459. Il donatore è il capo di Gelo Makadā, oggi distretto fra Gunaguna e Addigrat, comprendente anche Dabra Māʿṣo: consta infatti che già nella seconda metà del secolo XIV i capi di quel distretto cominciarno ad aver importanza e ad esercitare una certa influenza sulle regioni circostanti. Ed è assai probabile che ne' secoli XII, XIV ecc., non avendo l'Agāme. A quanto pare, una unità politica, andasse diviso nei feudi di Dabra Māʿṣo (cui poi sarebbe succeduto lo syum d Gelo Makadā), signoreggiante la parte orientale almeno fino agli alti monti ove ora è Edāgā Ḥamus, e di altri capi (p.e. Dabra Dāmo, di Awag, di Ambā Sanāyt ecc.), che se ne spartivano le terre d'occidnte.'

msItem.note: [5.10] = CCR 29: (II f. 13ra-b), according to AB. Carlo Conti Rossini comments on p.214: 'Grossa scrittura del secolo XVII o XVIII. In due colonne. Atti di èta assoluntamente dubbia, anche per lo stato del ms.: l'autore della donazione; confermando al convento il possesso d'un villagio, doveva essere un capo, di cui le cancellature non lasciano indovinare i titoli'.

[5.12] = CCR 28: (II f. 13vb), according to AB. Carlo Conti Rossini comments on pp.2013-214: 'Scrittura del secolo XVI: colonna. Atto non compiuto. Il donatore di schiavi al convento è il capo dello Ḥamāsēn, che assume il semplice titolo di šum: nell'atto n. 20, che è dell'anno 1328, il capo dello Ḥamāsēn è detto awfāri, con un vicario (?) chiamato ʿānṣān; ai tempi di re Zarʾa Yāʿqob aveva invece il titolo d kantibā (J.Perruchon, Les chronicles de Zar'a Ya'qob, p.48). Riesce quindi impossibile precisare la data dell'atto, che in ogni caso non è posteriore al secolo XVI.'

ab.seg: To the glory of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit.
in 505 year of mercy, I, king ʿAmda Ṣǝyon, gave to ’abbā Maṭā‘ of ’Aham so that he would beseech a reward for me in the Heavenly Kingdom,

gold 182, 2 crosses of gold and one dish of gold and ine chalice of gold; and one dish of silver, and one chalice of silver; 103 rich vetments to the church of Maṭā‘ and to the holy ones 40 fine cloths, and 30 rich vetments and 12 cows to the other churches in his land. And after all, I gave my own golden robe and my weapon and two ስራዌልየ taken from my wrist, and my pair of shoes from my feet. And all this I gave, knowing that the wealth of this world will pass, so that beloved Maṭā‘ would admit me to the Heavenly Kingdom, forever and ever, Amen.

div.ab: And for our King ʿAmda Ṣǝyon, who is the greatest among the kings on the earth, may God extend his days on the earth and establish him his ሥርዑ፡ as a moon and clearly as the Sun and may He protect his wives and his children and children of his children and may He save his army from of an arrow and from throwinging of a stone. And may He subdue his enemy and his adversaries. And on the day of his death, may He count him among the saints and martyrs and among those who pleased God, with Dawit and Qwosṭanṭinos and ʾAnoryos, for ever and ever, Amen.

And you, saints, those who dwells in the place of Maṭāʿ, pray for the King ʿAmda Ṣǝyon, at the evenings and at the daybreak, at time of noons,and at the hour of Qwǝrbān and during the māḫbar and by assembling, forever and ever, Amen.

To the glory of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit.

In the 507th year of Mercy, I, Bǝlen Sabā, the lady of Biḥat , wife of ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon,the king,because of the love to Maṭāʿ, so that he would beseech a reward for me in the Heavenly Kingdom, while I shall stay naked infront of the Heavenly King, Galabāand ʾƎnqarʿo, I gave this gwəlt to blessed Maṭāʿ, my beloved, which should not penestrate neither a horse nor an animal, neither a sǝyum of Dabra Māʿəṣo nor a sǝyum of Zaradā, neither an appointed one, nor the deposed one, neither the one who reigns nor who is agitated, neither who
gave a word to a king nor a child of the palace. And if there is anyone who transgresses or violate this gwəlt, which I gave to ʾabbā Maṭāʿ of ʾAham, while the kingʿĀmda Ṣǝyonand while the śǝyum of ʾƎntartā Bǝlen Sabā the lady of Biḥat and while māʾǝkala baḥǝr Samāy, and while śǝyum of Dabra Māʿəṣo Maṭre ʾEgziʾ, and while śǝyum of Zaredā Zarʾa Dāwit, and while ʿaqābe saʿata Maṭāʿ Gabra Krəstos. I gave this, knowing that the whole world will pass, and I heard the word of Ecclesiastes saying, 'Vanity, all is vanity, unless one prepares his provisions beforehead alive'. And I gave to Maṭā‘ and to the holly ones 150 cows and linen vestments and loaded offerings that I brought from ʾAmḥarā. If there will be anyone who usurps this gwəlt which I gave for offering and for commemoration of Maṭāʿ my beloved, may he be excommunicated by the mouth of the 15 prophets and by the mouth of 12 Apostles, by the mouth of 318 righteous of faith, by the mouth of Ṗeṭros liqa ṗāṗāsāt, by the prayer of the blessed Maṭāʿ and by the mouth of the Father. And the Son and the Holy Spirit may he be excommunicated in this world
and in the world that comes. This [transgression] can not be released through fasting or prayer, begging or bows for ages of ages, Amen. I offered this gwəlt and did all this as my lord King ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon ordered me, saying, 'Go, come to Maṭāʿof ʾAham and do the will of the blessed Maṭāʿ my beloved. And say: "Do not abandon, o Lord, my Lord ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon in the days of his youth"'. So I came and cried, wept and rolled myself on the grave of Maṭāʿ as ordered me my lord ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon. 'Do for him, o Lord, according to the desire of his heart, saying "Give ʾƎnqarʿo and Galabā, so that God give me in return for this little a lot in the Heavenly Kingdom, amen." May God give hime in return of a litle - great, amen. May God give him in return for that on the earth - that on the heaven, amen. In return for what ages - what does not age, amen. In return perished - what does not perish, amen. And may He prolong his days on the earth, amen. And may He subdue his rival
and his enemies, amen. And may he forgive his sins and obliterate the book of his debts, amen. May God give him wisdom as to Solomon, amen. May God give him benevolence as to Dāwit, amen. May God give him patience as to ʾƎyob, amen. May God give him victory as to ʾIyāsu, amen.

div.ab:
And for this Bǝlen Sabā the lady of Biḥat, may God give her love with her husbandʿĀmda Ṣǝyon, who fullfilled his will with her authority, as a good blessed servant that pleases his lord by his service, like this she did good by her service. May God give her good reward, amen. May God give her many days in joy, which do not have sadness, with her husbandʿĀmda Ṣǝyon,amen. And on the day of their summons may God announce them the word of joy saying: 'Come to me blessed by Father, inherit the kingdom, which was prepared for you from before the world, amen.' And may he bless their children, amen and may He multiply their seed like the stars of
Heaven and like the sand of the sea, amen and amen. And let all people say 'Amen and amen'.
And all you who read, pray for our King and our Quenn, so that God show mercy on them in heaven and on earth forever and ever, Amen.

To the glory of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit. I, ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon gave ʾAnfa Baʿat [to] Māryām za-Saʿagā Ḥǝṣen so that they celebrate the commemoration of Maṭāʿ and for me, so that my Lady Mary remember me in her prayer to her beloved Son. It was in 507 year of Mercy that I promoted, I, ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon, while śǝyǝmt of ʾƎntǝrtāBǝlen Sabā, whilemaʾǝkala bāḥrSamāy, and while ʾawfāri Dǝgnā. If there is anyone who usurps from Māryām za-Saʿagā ʾAnfa Baʿat Ḥǝṣen, which I,ʿĀmda Ṣǝyongave, if there is anyone who violates or transgresses it, if even maʾǝkala bāḥr or śǝyum of ʾƎntǝrtā, if even ʾawfāri or śǝyum of ʾAṣbi, if even a deputy or qāl nagāsi, may they be excommunicated, amen, by the mouth of Ṗeṭros liqa ṗāṗāsāt, amen; by the mouth of 318 righteous of faith, amen. And by Māryām, bearer of
Lord, may they be excommunicated, amen.

To the glory of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit. Restored I, Krǝstos ʾAbuhu,by the mouth ofʿĀmda Ṣǝyon, the king, Tarkā that previously the land of the holy ones of the church of Maṭāʿ, while ʿaqābe saʿat ʿƎqbā ʾƎgziʾ. And if there is anyone who would violate or pervert from the holy ones this land on the borders or cliffs of Tarkā, may he be excommunicated in front of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit by the mouth
of 318 righteous in faith and by the mouth of 15 prophets and by the mouth of 12 apostles and by the mouth of Ṗeṭros liqa ṗāṗāsāt, that will not be forgiven through fasting or prayer, through vows or bows unto the ages of ages, amen and amen. May it be so, may it be so. And if there is anyone who erase it or who scratch it in deceit, may he be likewise excommunicated unto the ages of ages, amen.

ab.seg: To the glory of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit.

div.ab: ወእንዘ፡ሀለዉ፡ክልኤሆሙ፡ኅቡረ፡ላሊበላ፡ንጉሥ፡ወብእሲቱ፡መስቀል፡ክብራ፡በአልተ፡ቢሐት፡ከመ፡ይኩኖሙ፡መድኀኒተ፡ነፍሶሙ፡በመንግሥተ፡ሰማያት፡ወለብእሲትየኒ፡ከመ፡ይደምራ፡ምስለ፡ቅድ ሳት፡ምስለ፡ሳራ፡ወሰራሜ፡ምስለ፡ሐና፡ወሶፍያ፡ወኢይዝክር፡ላቲ፡ኀጢአታ፡ወይደምስስ፡መጸሐፈ፡ጌጋያ፡አሜን።ወአሜን።ለይኩን፡ለይኩን።ወእንዘ፡ሀለዉ፡ዓበይተ፡܆ብጕና፡ ቃለጳስ፡አብት፡ ጳጳስ፡አባ፡ጊዮርጊስ፡ ወኤጲስ፡ቆጶስ፡ኀረዮ፡ ዓቃቤ፡ሰዓት፡መጣዕ፡ይርድአነ፡ክርስቶስ፡ ሊቀ፡ዲያቆናት፡ሰውን፡ ቀይሰ፡ገበዝ፡ጽዮን፡አብ፡ይኩን፡ መልሐዘ፡ይትባረክ፡ ቀስ፡ሐጺን፡ዘአዶናየ፡ ጸዋር፡ናርጌ፡መኣሰሬ፡ክርስቶስ፡ብነ፡ ጸሐፍ፡ላም፡ስብሐት፡ ሐስጓ፡ይዕቀበነ፡ ማእከለ፡ባሕር፡ኣስገደ፡ ዓቃ፡ጸንጸን፡ባራ፡ጽዮን፡ ዐቃብ፡ደጌ፡ማሰረይ፡ይምሐረነ፡ ሊቀ፡አቀይታት፡ዘረውድም፡ እንዘ፡ ሊቀ፡ኬኖት፡ዘአመላይ፡ ወእንዘ፡ ሊቀ፡ኅዳር፡ያሞ፡ ሊቀ፡መሰንቆ፡ወልደ፡ብጕናይ፡ ወከመዝ፡ኣጐላትኩ፡ዘኣልቦ፡ግብረ፡ወገብጋበ፡መፍቀሬ፡እግዚአብሔር፡ዘወሀበ፡ላሊበላ፡ዘንተ፡ጕልተ፡ዘገፍዓ፡ውጉዘ፡ለይኩን፡አሜን፡ዘንተ፡ዘአጽሐፈ፡ ዐቃቤ፡ስዐተ፡መጣዕ፡ስመ፡ልደቱ፡ይርድአነ፡ክርስቶስ፡ከመ፡ምንኵስናሁ፡ጸጋ፡መጣዕ፡ ለዘአጽሐፈ፡ወለዘጸሐፈ፡ስረዩ፡ወባርኩነ፡ኣሜን።

And while two were united, KingLālibālāandhis wifeMasqal Kǝbrabaʾalt of Biḥat, so that it become salvation of their souls in the Heavenly Kingdom, and for my wife may it associate her with saint women, with Sārā and Salome, with Ḥānnā and Sofiā and may He not remember her sin and may the book of her transgressions be obliterated, Amen and Amen.Let it be, let it be. And while the greats ofBǝgwǝna were qālaṗāsAbt, pāpāsʾabunaGiyorgis andʾeṗisqoṗos Ḫarayo, ʿāqābe saʿāt MaṭāʿYǝrdǝʾanna Krǝstos, liqa diyāqonātSawǝn, qaysa gabaz ṢǝyonʾAb Yǝkun, malḥazaYǝtbārak, qas ḥaṣinZa-’Adonāya, ṣawar nārge ma’āsareKrǝstos Bǝna, ṣaḥaf lāmSǝbḥat, ḥasgwāYǝ‘ǝqabanna, mā’ǝkala bāḥrʾAsgada, ‘aqā ṣanṣanBārā Ṣeyon, ‘aqāb dage māsarayYǝmḥaranna, liqa ’aqqaytātZara Wǝdǝm, while liqa kenotZa-ʾAmalāy and while liqa ḫǝdārYāmo, liqa masanqoWalda Bǝgwǝnāy. Thus at that time I promoted this gwǝlt given by Lālibālā, lover of God, without taxation or forced labour; who will restrain this gwǝlt, shall that one be excommunicated, Amen. This was written upon the request of ʿāqābe saʿāt Maṭāʿ, [named] at birth Yǝrdǝʾanna Krǝstos and at entering monkhood as Ṣaggā Maṭāʿ. Relent that one who requested to write [this] and that one who wrote [this] and bless us, Amen.

ab.seg: To the glory of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit,
I, Yǝrdǝʾanna Krǝstos of Bəgwənāy of Ṣəlālā, ‘aqābe sa‘āta Maṭā‘gave

thirty two fields of Biḥāt, to be granted by Maṭā‘ in the Heavenly Kingdom. I gave to Maṭā‘ as a donation what Walda Ma’əkali, the lord of the land, gave me agreeing and willing, who knows that what I took was not by force or violence. If someone would violate or defraud Maṭā‘, whether appointed or whether displaced, be excommunicated, in this world and in the coming world, by the mouth of Maṭā‘ and by the mouth of Jesus Christ. Amen. Let it be, let it be.

የሀቦ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ጥበበ፡ ከመ፡ ሰሎሞን፡ አሜን።

And while two were united, KingLālibālāandhis wifeMasqal Kǝbrabaʾalt of Biḥat, so that it become salvation of their souls in the Heavenly Kingdom, and for my wife may it associate her with saint
women, with Sārā and Salome, with Ḥānnā and Sofiā and may her sin not to be remembered and may the book of her transgressions be obliterated, Amen and Amen.Let it be, let it be. And while the greats were in strike, qālaṗāsAbt, pāpāsʾabunaGiyorgis andʾeṗisqoṗos Ḫarayo, ʿāqābe saʿāt MaṭāʿYǝrdǝʾanna Krǝstos, liqa diyāqonātSawǝn, qaysa gabaz ṢǝyonʾAb Yǝkun, malḥazaYǝtbārak, qas ḥaṣinZa-’Adonāya, ṣawar nārge ma’āsareKrǝstos Bǝna, ṣaḥaf lāmSǝbḥat, ḥasgwā Yǝ‘ǝqabanna, mā’ǝkala bāḥrʾAsgada, ‘ǝqā ṣanṣanBārā Ṣeyon, ‘aqāb dage māsarayYǝmḥaranna, liqa ’aqqaytātZara Wǝdǝm, while liqa kenotZa-ʾAmalāy and while liqa ḫǝdārYāmo, liqa masanqoWalda Bǝgwǝnāy. Thus at that time I promoted this gwǝlt given by Lālibālā, lover of God, without taxation or forced labour; who will restrain this gwǝlt, shall that one be excommunicated, Amen. This was written upon the request of ʿāqābe saʿāt Maṭāʿ, [named] at birth Yǝrdǝʾanna Krǝstos and at entering monkhood
as Ṣaggā Maṭāʿ. Relent that one who requested to write [this] and bless us, Amen.
